body:
This change was needed due to the ternary boolean operator returning `unsigned long` vs `unsigned long long`. Forcing the `1ul` to `unsigned long long` seemed to resolve the issue.

I see the `nomac` tag in the build files. However, am I supposed to explicitly add the `nomac` tag when running my tests? I had run `bazel test -c opt -- //tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/compiler/... -//tensorflow/contrib/lite/...`.
body_html:
This change was needed due to the ternary boolean operator returning unsigned long vs unsigned long long. Forcing the 1ul to unsigned long long seemed to resolve the issue.

I see the nomac tag in the build files. However, am I supposed to explicitly add the nomac tag when running my tests? I had run bazel test -c opt -- //tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/compiler/... -//tensorflow/contrib/lite/....
body_text:
This change was needed due to the ternary boolean operator returning unsigned long vs unsigned long long. Forcing the 1ul to unsigned long long seemed to resolve the issue.
I see the nomac tag in the build files. However, am I supposed to explicitly add the nomac tag when running my tests? I had run bazel test -c opt -- //tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/compiler/... -//tensorflow/contrib/lite/....
